FuncDef:
The ethernet pvid command specifies a default VLAN ID for an interface. After the interface receives untagged packets, it adds a VLAN tag carrying the default VLAN ID to the packets.
The undo ethernet pvid command deletes the default VLAN ID of an interface.
By default, no default VLAN ID is specified for interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the default VLAN ID of an interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Run the ethernet pvid command to add the default VLAN ID to untagged packets.
Configuration Impact
The ethernet pvid command applies only to scenarios in which users access an L2VPN through an interface.
